org.jcatapult.mvc.parameter.convert
Class AbstractGlobalConverter

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.mvc.parameter.convert.AbstractGlobalConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
GlobalConverter
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractPrimitiveConverter, CollectionConverter, DateTimeConverter, EnumConverter, FileConverter, LocalDateConverter, LocaleConverter, MoneyConverter, StringConverter
public abstract class AbstractGlobalConverter
extends Object
implements GlobalConverter

This class is the base type converter for all the type converters that handle Object types. If you are writing a converter for primitive types, use the AbstractPrimitiveConverter class.

This class mostly delegates between the various method calls by passing in default values or performing casting. Each method describes how it functions.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Constructor Detail

AbstractGlobalConverter

public AbstractGlobalConverter()
Method Detail

convertFromStrings

public Object convertFromStrings(String[] values,
                                 Type convertTo,
                                 Map<String,String> dynamicAttributes,
                                 String expression)
                          throws ConversionException,
                                 ConverterStateException
Handles the following cases:
  • Null - returns null
  • Type is an array - calls stringToArray
  • Type is not an array and values length is 1 or 0 - calls stringToObject
  • Type is an array and values length is > 1 - calls stringsToArray
  • Type is not an array and values length is > 1 - calls stringsToObject

Specified by:
convertFromStrings in interface GlobalConverter
Parameters:
values - The values to convert.
convertTo - The type to convert to.
dynamicAttributes - The dynamic attributes used to assist in conversion.
expression - The full path to the expression that is causing the conversion.
Returns:
The converted value.
Throws:
ConversionException - If the conversion failed.
ConverterStateException - if the converter didn't have all of the information it needed to perform the conversion.

parameterType

protected Class<?> parameterType(Type type)
Gets the first parameter type is the given type is a parameterized type. If it isn't, this returns null. If the type has multiple parameters, only the first is returned.

Parameters:
type - The type.
Returns:
The first parameter type.

stringsToObject

protected abstract Object stringsToObject(String[] values,
                                          Type convertTo,
                                          Map<String,String> dynamicAttributes,
                                          String expression)
                                   throws ConversionException,
                                          ConverterStateException
Converts a String array to a single Object (not an array of Objects). Support for this method is uncommon.
